Generate Code Co-occurrence Network

Source: R/Analysis_Functions.R
generate_code_co_occurrence_network.Rd

Creates a network visualization showing how different codes co-occur in the text. Codes are represented as nodes, and lines between nodes indicate co-occurrence, with line thickness proportional to co-occurrence frequency.

Usage

generate_code_co_occurrence_network(annotations)

Arguments

annotations

Data frame containing columns:

  • code: Factor or character vector of code names

  • other columns are ignored

Value

A recorded plot object (from grDevices::recordPlot) showing the co-occurrence network. If 0 or 1 codes are present, returns a simple plot with an appropriate message.

Examples

# Create sample annotations with co-occurring codes
annotations <- data.frame(
  code = c("Code1", "Code2", "Code1", "Code2", "Code3"),
  start = c(1, 1, 10, 10, 20),
  end = c(5, 5, 15, 15, 25),
  stringsAsFactors = FALSE
)

# Generate and display the network
network <- generate_code_co_occurrence_network(annotations)
#> Error in generate_code_co_occurrence_network(annotations): could not find function "generate_code_co_occurrence_network"

# Example with single code
single_code <- data.frame(
  code = "Code1",
  start = 1,
  end = 5,
  stringsAsFactors = FALSE
)
single_network <- generate_code_co_occurrence_network(single_code)
#> Error in generate_code_co_occurrence_network(single_code): could not find function "generate_code_co_occurrence_network"
